    • Method Detail

      • substr

        public static String substr(String string,
            int from)
        Extract a slice from string. If from is negative, count from the end of the string. For example, substr("Hello", -2) returns "lo". If string is null this method returns null. If from is greater than the string's length, this method returns EMPTY.
        Parameters:
        string - The String to extract a slice from
        from - The start index of the slice within string (may be negative)
        Returns:
        The slice

      • substr

        public static String substr(String string,
            int from,
            int length)
        Extract a slice from string. If from is negative, count from the end of the string. For example, substr("Hello", -4, 3) returns "ell". If string is null this method returns null. If from is greater than the string's length, this method returns EMPTY. If length is less then 1, this method returns EMPTY.
        Parameters:
        string - The String to extract a slice from
        from - The start index of the slice within string (may be negative)
        length - The length the slice (must be positive or you will receive an empty String).
        Returns:
        The slice

      • substring

        public static String substring(String string,
               int from,
               int to)
        Extract a slice from string. If from is negative, the start of the slice is counted from the end of the string.If to is negative, the end of the slice is counted from the end of the string. For example, substr("Hello", -4, -1) returns "ell". If string is null this method returns null. If from is greater than the string's length, this method returns EMPTY. If length is less then 1, this method returns EMPTY.
        Parameters:
        string - The String to extract a slice from
        from - The start index of the slice (may be negative)
        to - The end index (not inclusive) of the slice (may be negative)
        Returns:
        The slice

      • toString

        public static String toString(byte[] bytes)
        Null-save equivalent of new String(bytes, Charset.forName("UTF-8")).
        Parameters:
        bytes - The byte array to convert
        Returns:
        The String created from the bytes or null is bytes is null

      • split

        public static String[] split(String s,
             String delim,
             int numParts)
        Null-safe split method that does not interpret the delimiter as a regular expression.
        Parameters:
        s - The string to split
        delim - The delimiter around which to split
        numParts - The expected number of parts (might end up larger)
        Returns:

      • trim

        public static String trim(String s,
          char c)
        Trim the specified character off both sides of the specified String. This method returns an empty String if the specified String is null.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to trim
        c - The character to trim off the String
        Returns:
        The trimmed String.

      • ltrim

        public static String ltrim(String s,
           char c)
        Trim the specified character off the beginning of the specified String. This method returns an empty String if the specified String is null.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to trim
        c - The character to trim off the String
        Returns:
        The trimmed String.

      • trim

        public static String trim(String s,
          char... chars)

        public static String trim(String s,
          String chars)

      • rtrim

        public static String rtrim(String s,
           char c)
        Trim the specified character off the end of the specified String. This method returns an empty String if the specified String is null.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to trim
        c - The character to trim off the String
        Returns:
        The trimmed String.

      • isTrue

        public static boolean isTrue(String s)
        Equivalent to isTrueValue(value, true). In other words null and empty Strings are considered to be true!
        Parameters:
        value - The String to convert to a boolean
        Returns:
        See Also:
        #isTrueValue(String, boolean)

      • isTrue

        public static boolean isTrue(String s,
             boolean dfault)
        Convert the specified String to a boolean value. Returns dfault if the string is null or empty. Returns true if the specified value is is one of ["true", "1", "yes", "on"]. Otherwise this method returns false. The string is trimmed before being compared to these values.
        Parameters:
        value - The String to convert to a boolean
        dfault - The value to return if value is null or empty
        Returns:

        Returns:

                        String charset)

        Parameters:

        charset - The character encoding to apply
        Returns:
        The resulting InputStream
